intro: Syncolostemon stalmansii, commonly known as the Stalmans' syncolostemon, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the rainforest. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
